messages.messageBody:
I found the link where I learned about the phrase "I can do this and I do it" that I mentioned in my last post. If anyone wants to listen, it's at this website (I have no affiliation): http://www.languageofattraction.com/8words/8words_thankyou+audio.htm

Tracy
PS I had to sign-in so if this page doesn't appear, you can access it by inputting your name and email address here: http://www.languageofattraction.com/8%20Words%20sign-up.htm

messages.subject: Beliefs was Re: Food and behavior
messages.msgSnippet: Wow this thread has really taken off! I just finished reading most of the posts, and have to say that I have been somewhat like a few posters in that I use to
messages.messageBody:
Wow this thread has really taken off! I just finished reading most of the posts, and have to say that I have been somewhat like a few posters in that I use to "believe" that X, Y and Z are "bad" foods that should be avoided at all costs. And I "fed" that fear to my family! Ugh!

More recently I've been *awakening* to the understanding that no one way in Anything is the *right* way to do that thing - whether eating sugar, or anything else in life. I have taken to asking myself this question whenever I'm "certain" about something:

"Can I let go of being SO smart, and allow this to be other than what I think it is?"

Because what I *know* is true, is only true for me. And to take it further, it's only true for me because I *believe* that it's true. And belief is just a thought that I keep thinking, and we create with our thoughts/thoughts are creative. As I accept this more and more (basis in quantum physics) I can take life and parenting less seriously, because what it means is, I am in control.** And no, I do not yet remember this all of the time, especially in the heat of the moment:-)

Tracy

**Book recommendations for the curious:
Scientific bent -
The Biology of Belief - Bruce Lipton (I suggest this be read first)
Spontaneous Evolution - also by Lipton
The Spontaneous Healing of Belief - Gregg Braden
Living The Field - Lynne McTaggart
The Intention Experiment - Lynne McTaggart
Holographic Universe - Michael Talbot
If you prefer video - Consciousness - 20 Scientists, 9 hours on 5 DVDs

Fiction based on fact -
The Lost Symbol - Dan Brown (I just started reading this today)
